do so.”
This argument is seldom expressed quite so openly as in the form above.
But it affects most of us who think about it at all. We like to believe that Man
is in some subtle way superior to the rest of creation. It is best if he can be
shown to be necessarilysuperior, for then there is no danger of him losing his
commanding position. The popularity of the theological argument is clearly
connected with this feeling. It
